Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for kids, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amw48
Reviews.Content: Me and my 7 year old daughter stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Its a good location right next to the public beach where you can go for a jog, roller blade etc and near to malls etc - 15 mins away from the dubai mall where theres an aquarium, ice skating, 25 mins away from mall of the emirates (indoor skiing) and 35 mins away from atlantis (great water park). The facilities at the hotel are excellent for kids with 3 pools including a toddler pool and a small play center for kids aged 2-5. The food was good with a wide range of restaurants and the room service food was very good. The staff, those from india and philippines, were really friendly, the other staff were not so friendly or responsive. The hotel offered a free exntension for check out to 2.00pm which was good. The rooms, at least the standard rooms, are not so great. Dated and not good lighting as not much of a window and what there is faces into a wall. Prison cell like feeling. We changed rooms to another standard room that had a basement feeling but was better than the one on the 2nd floor. The grounds of the hotel are really pretty and spread out. There were a lot of unfriendly russian tourists staying there. The breakfast was over priced (90 dir) and so we ate over the rd at the lime tree and at a local cafe while we there.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good”
Reviews.Author: sheikinallover
Reviews.Content: Good location for exploring Dubai but also for relaxing. Several bars, restaurants and nightclubs on site but the rooms are far enough away from this to be quiet and peaceful. Good breakdast place across Juneirah Road which is a popular expat and Jumeirah Jane hangout(The Lime Tree). Spinneys supermarket next door tho this and plenty of beach malls around. DIyafah street is a short walk away, good for outdoor eating. The outdoor bar is popular with the media crowd at the weekend, if you like that kind of thing. Beach is ok, swimming pools good. Staff friendly and service is great. They seem to have jacked up the prices of late so it would not be my first choice now.

Reviews.Title: “Arabian Fairy-tale”
Reviews.Author: Summerrest
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 wonderful days in Dubai, having changed our cold, windy weather to sunny, fresh air, white sand and bright blue water of Persian Gulf. This January turned to be a fairy-tale in the different world of different culture. The hotel Dubai Marine Beach Resort & Spa (Jumeirah District) is a very special place if you want to combine a relaxing rest at the beach, every day morning walks along the coastline and nice trips around outstanding city of Dubai. The places which we visited were extremely marvelous and even fantastic. Atlantis hotel of the Jumeirah Palm Islands, Dubai Mall, The Dubai Fountain, Burj Khalifa, Gold Souk, Burj Al Arab, Jumeirah Mosque, Souk Madinat Jumeirah – these landmarks we”ll never forget! The best impression which will always stay with us – beautiful, slow life every moment of which is unforgettable and full of taste and style. The taxis are fast, the food is delicious and healthy, the streets are clean, the wind is refreshing, local people living their independent life full of traditions which they carefully keep and save. This trip made us understand that the world is wonderful and it has many places for exploration and enjoyment.Hope to visit this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: DM787
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two months whilst working in Dubai. The rooms are set out in an open area not like a conventional hotel. You get to them by going through the main reception area and then outside and walk along a rather nice path amongst bushes and streams to the block that your room is in. The blocks each have four rooms, with two on the ground floor and two above. In the time I was there I had no problems with noise from any other rooms but there is a Mosque close by with the call to prayer which can be fairly loud. There is a good room service menu with good food and portion size. In the complex there are a number of restaurants and bars so there’s a good choice if you don’t want to venture further afield. If you do want to go out, with the hotel being beside the main beach road its easy to grab a taxi. Just beware that the hotel taxis that sit outside charge more than the local ones. The pool area is nice with plenty of loungers and grassy areas with a beach bar nearby that serves through the day into the evening. You can also get food which will be brought out to you on the loungers if you like. The beach itself not that big but always found it to be clean. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful, front desk staff less so! To sum up it is a decent hotel but not amazing, especially compared to some of the newer hotels Dubai has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ashishk99
Reviews.Content: It is on of the very few hotels with the Private Beach and great spa for you to relax and have the complete holiday on the beach and boasts a wonderful ocean .An Excellent Experience service is also good it is one of the best places to be in.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed lot”
Reviews.Author: sun k
Reviews.Content: It is very nice experince service is good, rate is also good, in short I can say one of best place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: clovebs
Reviews.Content: The Dubai Beach Marine Resort and Spa was a pleasant surprise. As advertised, it is truly on the beach and boasts a wonderful ocean view (although I’m not sure many of the guest rooms actually have a view). We reserved a standard twin room. Upon check-in we were offered an upgrade but opted out; our travel companion took the upgrade. The size difference in the rooms was tremendous … essentially double the size. However, we had ample space and ended up not spending too much time in the room anyway. Wi-fi was free. Check-in was quick and painless. On-site restaurants were great. For breakfast we ended up heading out across the street to the plentiful coffee shops to grab breakfast (cheaper than the hotel). I did not use the spa services but I understand they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dubai Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulinkabul
Reviews.Content: one of the few hotels with a private beach which is not at the marina. Interesting layout of rooms, multiple pools, lots of restaurants, great for kids. A little far from the shopping malls and not on the Metro, but still worth a try if you are looking for a beach holiday in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated mediocre 'tired' hotel, for the same price ...go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPohl
Reviews.Content: I am frequently in the UAE for business. After a hectic working week, we (3 seasoned business travellers )checked into this hotel looking forward to have a few days rest before heading back to our respective countries of residence. Well, one day and one night at the Dubai Marine Beach Resort place was enough for us. Its not that we are demanding customers or that we expect too much. All we needed was a well managed hotel with a decent beach and the luxury of being able to have a good night's sleep, or even an afternoon nap. Well here is summary of our experiences: The front desk staff was at all times just doing its job - reluctantly, unfriendly, nonchalant, with an attitude as if they were doing us a favour; seems to me that either they lack managerial support/expertise ..or they just don't give a hoot. Our rather dark rooms were actually almost like a Japanese hotel ..a bed with walls around. Our windows faced a wall - thus the darkness, and behind this wall there was a mosque ..with 5 daily very loud prayer sessions ..which meant you got woken up at pre-dawn, you couldn't have a peaceful afternoon nap, and you had it blaring at your room during the night... Well, it is is a beach hotel ..so we tried the already rather limited hotel beach front - what a sight: you have a industrial-type concrete retaining wall on one side and on the other side there is the port. If felt like you were actually on some sort of industrial beach front and they allowed you access to a small slice of their yard to use for leisure. Now - remember .you are staying at a beach hotel ! So you think you could chill out, forget about work and just enjoy the little strip of beach and the beach front. Not so. We were now about to discover 4 amazing things that you CANNOT do at the hotel beach front: ACHTUNG 1: All guests have to clear the beach by 6pm..you can't even sit on the beach with a glass of something and enjoy the later afternoon breeze & sun. ACHTUNG 2: All guests have to vacate the beach front deck chairs . ACHTUNG 3: Given the fact that there wasn't much of a beach to use anyway, we decided to use the shaded beach bar to stay out of the sun for a while. But, here comes the next stupid rule : The would not allow you to eat at the beach bar ..not even a sandwich ..they actually want you to eat at their tables in the hot blazing sun. Well , we ordered our meals at the table and then carried our food to the beach bar. ACHTUNG 4: The beach bar has this beautiful Italian coffee machine. BUT the rule is that they will not serve coffee / espresso / cappuccino after 5pm. No reason given. This was the last straw. So now ..there you have it ..a beach hotel with amazing rules - lousy rooms, poor overall maintenance, front desk staff with an attitude ..it felt like we were somewhere in Russia. This hotel is said to be the oldest beach hotel in Dubai ...and it really shows. By the way, the hotel is very popular with over-sized middle-aged Russians as well with Middle Eastern customers. We checked out, and went further up to the other side of the Jumeirah beach front ..found ourselves a nice hotel, - same price, better service, a nice beach front, and no stupid rules.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot to be on the beach and 5 min.close to the shopping”
Reviews.Author: leylek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the beginning of the Jumeriah beach very close to the old town, dubai mall and convention centre. There are 4-5 different open air restaurant choices and also a popular club at the hotel. (Thursday- friday nights it is a nice place to hang out.) Good choice for business + a couple days beach escape. Negatives: Hotel is not new rooms are dated a little bit, have a small beach The lady at the Concierge was excellent, recommend us the right spots for dining and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Suite is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Yasir_Nazir
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the royal suite which is like a house and extremely spacious. The staff at the beach and the entire facility is really nice and cooperative. You must try the spa if you ever happen to stay this facility. There are multiple small pools for different suites so it is kind of fun hopping from one pool to another. I would definitely suggest to stay there and try the royal suite.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again..”
Reviews.Author: KannanPillai
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience staying here. The highlight is the view and food ...awesome is the word...Excellent service and the room quality is worth the pricing..I had travelled with my friends on this October 2011, we are planning to come back again...definitely we are sure its not gonna disappoint us......cheers..

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Best Value”
Reviews.Author: Fire S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Dubai Marine for a week in September 2011 for a business trip with my partner. I am so much of a water person. I find it relaxing whenever I see water features around me. I simply love this hotel because it has everything I needed in a hotel. A hotel doesn't need to be fancy to be called 5-star. Because the 5-star rating has to cover every aspect of the hotel. The service, the ambiance, the look, comfort, accessibility and basically everything that would make any traveller feel like home away from home with luxury and style. This hotel has it all for me. The people are very warm especially from the housekeeping they made sure that I and my partner have everything that we needed as we are on a business trip. Imagine how hectic our life can be? But these people made our stay worthwhile and hassle-free. Definitely kudos to the Management!!! A few more improvements on the sound-proofing will do this hotel better to cater to the needs of those staying in the villas near the high-way. This is mostly where the problem comes in as you see on the reviews. For me I had a really good location so I wasn't really bothered by such noise. As of the rooms being small, I also woudn't bother...admit it you do not stay in the room the whole day!!! so why do you need a spacious room? I see nothing wrong with it. I would rather have an over-sized bed in a small room rather than a small bed in an over-sized room. So please don't be mean people we just want comfort so I guess it would be fair enough to not exagerate. The beach is fantastic, the pool is very well maintained and the bar and restaurants is just inside the facility which makes you not ever needing to go out to find a decent meal or hang-out. They have it all HERE!!! I love this place. I would say it is a HAVEN for travellers with the best VALUE for you Money! Definitely staying here whenever I am in Dubai!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “If you're Russian, or like being around Russians, come here.”
Reviews.Author: Chalfont
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Dubai Marine several times as my company puts me here on business trips. I would certainly agree with the other reviewers who say that this place is definitely not 5-star standard. Many of the rooms are small and dark - you will need the lights on even during the bright Dubai daytime and noise from inconsiderate people banging their doors may be a problem due to the echoey nature of the hallways. You may also suffer noise from what I assume is air-conditioning plant at the back of some of the villas. Check-in and check-out are often very slow. The breakfast buffet is very good, but the food and drink prices are outrageous and the quality of the evening food is not always good. As a Brit, complaining to the management doesn't come easily, but this is one of the few places anywhere in the world that I have sent a meal back and refused to pay. Most of the service staff seem to be Indian, which is usual for this part of the world, and their attitude and politeness is generally very good. Unfortunately, the same can not be said of some of the Eastern European staff on the front desk, whose surly, dismissive demeanor borders on rudeness. On the subject of Eastern Europeans, out of curiosity I once enquired at the front desk whether the hotel is Russian owned, because several staff, including management, are Russian, and this hotel attracts MANY Russian guests. I was told that it is not Russian owned, but if you've ever had experience of Russia (many times for me) or Russian people you will understand the significance of this paragraph. Having stayed at the Dubai Marine several times I feel I know the place quite well, which makes me feel a little suspicious when I read the recent rave reviews (July & August 2011) below this one. Notably, the reviewers have only reviewed this one hotel. Hmmm... In general I quite like going to Dubai, and in general the Dubai Marine is OK, but each time I leave this hotel I quietly vow that it will be the last time I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: skusderci
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Dubai Marine Beach Resort & Spa, it's claiming to be a 5 star hotel, possibly once years ago, but the shine has worn off a long time ago. I am in the "Family suite" this constitutes a very small bedroom with a king size bed, basically this is the bedroom, a lounge area, a small walk in closet and a large bathroom. The pillows on the bed are in dire need of replacement, I didn't even want to use them, as I made the mistake of taking them out of their casing, b/c they were so lumpy and uncomfortable I wanted to reshape them, they were really just disgusting. Other issues are the furnishings; the sofa has many stains on it that have been repeatedly cleaned, or attempted to be cleaned off. The furnishings are sparse and give the impression that they've seen better days, not to mention their lack of comfort. Housekeeping is not the greatest, when asking for extra towels I was told yes and then never received them, repeatedly. I forgot to pack my bath toiletries, and used the hotel's complimentary items, thinking they'd be replaced the next day...they were topped up with water, I've never encountered this before in any hotel. Wait staff at the pool bar are basically a bunch of 20 something boys who hang around checking out the women at the beach, even so far as the Lifeguard blowing his whistle 3 times when a women worthy of approval walks by. It's rather barbaric, he attempted to chat me up, and kept giving me huge cheesy grins and winking at me until I asked the waiters to tell him to stop, they pretended they didn't understand my English, and I told them if he didn't I'd go to the supervisor, he understood me very quickly after this. It was not at all what I expected from a "5 star hotel" I found it to be insulting and inappropriate. It is rather costly at £170/night or $225 US with no extras,(this was a special discount internet rate my Assistant found) breakfast was not included, this was an additional £18 per person, or $25 US, this wasn't anything spectacular either, your basic breakfast buffet for double the cost. The beach cushions were dirty and old looking, and the side tables were filthy and worn, replacing these would cost minimal, and make the beach look substantially better. There is NO cold water in the room, the best you can expect is warm water, due to the fact that they don't cool the water, as it's "too costly" Overall, I'd say this is no where near a 5 Star hotel, charging higher rates does not make it a higher class hotel it just makes it an expensive mid range hotel. Stay somewhere else for less money, and better rooms/service. I'm off to try the spa tomorrow after my day of meetings, for £52 or $70 US for 1 hour, I must say it's a decent price, fingers crossed. The Mexican Restaurant next door is very good, however also very pricey, the Lebanese restaurant is fantastic, and offers belly dancers and an Arabic Singer, who is pretty amazing. Overall I'd say this is a mid range hotel pretending to be a 5 star, I'd never stay here again. Wifi in the rooms is intermittent and disconnects constantly.

Reviews.Title: “An oldy tropical 90's 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: izumiishi
Reviews.Content: Its an oldie nice hotel. This is not a 5 stars hotel at all. The bests are the beach and the layout that remains A tropical environment. Rooms are comfortable,it has a saloon, a spacious dressing room where is the mini bar, the fridge didnt work as a fridge, and the worst part is that I ve found hairs everywhere... In the blanket, bathroom, corner of the dressing room...Disgusting! The restaurants are normal but the main atracction seemed to be the night club. Luckily our villa were far from it! Because is working all night every night. if your expectations are an oldy likeable 4 stars hotel is recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Awesum Experience”
Reviews.Author: speedyy8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai but the Dubai marine has been the best. From the minute we walked in, we were wowed by it. The staff, from the front desk to our butler, were super friendly and helpful. We were always met with a smile and asked how we were. The rooms are an amazing size, with luxuorious beds, fantastic bathroom, great lounge area and balcony. The pool was great and the poolside service was an added bonus. I have not stayed at a hotel in Dubai where we are constantly hydrated with iced tea and fruit. Every small detail has been thought about at this hotel. If we needed anything, at any time of day or night, it was bought to us within minutes. I would stay at this hotel without even considering any other.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay,”
Reviews.Author: DonnaKronmiller
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, the air conditioning works well in the room, room service is very nice and prompt, the pools were luke warm so not very refreshing when you get into them, the restaurants are very expensive to eat at. The beach they have is very, very small so not much room to swim or lay out in the sun. Do not use the taxi's that do not have writing on them they are not real taxi's and charge you more money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and understated Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: CathyCat_11
Reviews.Content: After living inDubai for many years we wanted somewhere to stay for our last week here whilst we tied up all the loose ends with our house etc. we chose the Dubai Marine because of it's situation and price and the fact that it was a place we remember form our early years in this country. Over the years we 'd seen all the flash, brash and blingy side of Dubai and wanted to leave with some of it's original charm still in our minds. While Dubai Marine is classed as 5 Star it is definitely not in the league of the 5 Star Jumeirah Beach Hotel. However, the villas surrounded by tropical greenery have a more personal quality and the room itself was pleasantly and simply furnished with a very comfortable bed and sitting room area. Elemis products in the bathroom were atypical Dubai touch. One thing I would add is that the reception staff are a bit off-hand and the porters were not up to usual Dubai standard. However, room service and housekeeping services were speedy and obliging. Though the cleanliness of the room was high there was a slight smell of cigarettes and when my son used the jacuzzi in the bath room he was sprayed with rust!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, I will definately go there again”
Reviews.Author: BuDavid
Reviews.Content: it was more than I expected, since the rooms were cleans, the layout was beautiful, but there was a really annoying thing that was in many reviews I've seen before I go there which was the CLIMATE CONTROL, it was freezing and blowing right on top of my head! there is something wrong with it, but some of my friends didn't seem to bother, but most of people would do I assume. it was right at the beach, you just take 5 minutes walk from the villas area to the health club where you take your towel and there is the beach, not big, but big enough to enjoy. I won't give a five star because of the climate control, I couldn't sleep well because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff - should be with”
Reviews.Author: Deen_14
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel at all. Worst ever in Dubai I would say – especially in terms of customer service. They provide a’ take it or leave it service’ so if you are in a situation and have a problem do not approach the hotel attendants – they run a monarchy. In case of in house restaurants – the management does not seem to have any control over them so they treat you as they like. The guys who are outside the restaurant –Malecon- decide who to let in and who not to (depends on their mood) – and if you ask a question about anything at all, you will be shouted at. Don’t even try to complain to the manager because the manager, Zubair does not think its necessary to speak to the guests and sort the situation. Instead, he would like to hide himself so he does not have to deal with the situation. If you try to email the management with details of your concern, the F&B department/Manager– no one cares to respond to your emails – clearly the hotel does not take customer service seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Service and staff to be improved”
Reviews.Author: mac_elina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Pretty unusual environment for business travelers, but good alternative. Definitely it is more a holiday hotel, but we enjoyed the access to the beach. A bit disappointed because the swimming pool closed at 7pm - when you are coming back from an all-day meeting, we didn't have time to enjoy it ! Maybe becasue it was still consider to be winter. Food is ok. Service is so slow and not very professional - except the concierge staff which is good - the reception desk took about 5 minutes to realize that I was there willing to check out and it took them about 15 minutes to finish the process, even though my room was prepaid already !! Otherwise , the place is surrounded with night clubs and bars, if you want to have nice time during nights ! but I am sure the place is also convenient for family stay. Internet connection in rooms is very slow, but free !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: KR2903
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the DMBR for 4 nights in January. Neither of us had been to Dubai on holiday before and we were keen to stay on Jumerah Beach as we had heard that this is where the best hotels were. We arrived on the Virgin flight at around 8am and therefore got to the hotel at 9.30ish. We walked up to the reception desk and were completely ignored by the attendant for a good 2mins. When he finally looked up and brusquely asked for our names and passport, he told us that our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm as check out isn't til 12pm! We said that we were not told about this and his general attitude was pretty much "tough luck". It was then the kindly Phillipino porter who took us downstairs and allowed us to change and leave our bags, who advised us to go and relax by the pool and he would come find us when the rooms were ready. Every contact we had with the reception staff from then on, I have to say I found them to be disinterested, unprofessional, unfriendly and generally unhelpful. Our first impression of the Hotel was great disappointment and unfortunately for this reason I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else. The rooms are clean and well ordered, the bed was extremely comfortable and although there is no view, we liked spending time in the room. The small private beach is beautiful and the pools are very nice. There is a large mosque directly opposite the hotel so you can clearly hear the call to prayer several times a day (Inc 5am!) but I found this quite beautiful and haunting and I wouldn't say it was a nuisance at all. There are several restaurants in the complex which are good value for money and the food is delicious. We liked the Thai and Flooka fish restaurats the best. Overall this Hotel has great potential, the basics are great and the facilities really make this a fine resort but the staff really let it down at times. In a hotel of this calibre you really expect a friendly smile and a can do attitude from the staff, unfortunately we found neither were apparent here.

Reviews.Title: “nice beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: martin4711
Reviews.Content: spent three days at this beach hotel: nice poold; great foot, a bit overpriced. The hotels runs several bars or lounges, but we only managed to enter one. (we did not insist)

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel? No, not really.”
Reviews.Author: STL40_10
Reviews.Content: Booked a week of winter sun and chose this hotel on the basis of its rating and the fact that its one of the few hotels in Dubai boasting a private beach. Having arrived very early on Saturday morning, (3.00am local time), the receptionist's attempts to upgrade us to a suite for an additional £170 were not welcome and, in hindsight, gave a good indication of the hotel's attitude to its guests. First impressions of the room were generally positive - a fair size, free safe, well stocked mini-bar, wall-mounted flat screen TV, serviceable bathroom and balcony. At 4.45am were awoken by the first call to prayer of the day. Whilst this is to be expected, the Jumierah Mosque, (just over the road from the hotel), is one of the largest in Dubai and possesses an incredibly powerful loud speaker system. No mention of this in the literature interestingly enough. We were awoken at the same time each day. Breakfast gave us the first opportunity to see the hotel in daylight. The grounds are fantastic, incorporating a wide array of water features and greenery. Each and every member of staff said hello as we passed; the general ambiance was exactly what we were looking for. This spell was broken as soon as we entered the breakfast area in the so-called Taverna. Whilst the food is good the service is surprisingly poor, not because the staff are incompetent, but because there are simply not enough of them. One of the main reasons which set five star establishments apart from the rest is the attentiveness of the staff, who generally go out of their way to make the say as memorable as possible. Not at this hotel! A further distasteful factor was the way in which the manger of the restaurant spoke to his staff in front of guests. Quite inappropriate and rude; little wonder they didn't appear motivated. The pool areas are good but guess what? That's right; the attendants will happily stand and watch guests wrestle with umbrellas and sun loungers until they do themselves an injury. Order a cup of tea from the pool bar and, if you're lucky, it might arrive 15minutes later, usually without a pot of milk. Then you'll get the bill - 18 Dirhams, (about £3.20), so no doubt that the prices are five star! The beach rescued the whole place in my opinion and single-handedly justified the price of the holiday. The sea is pleasant and clean and the beach is soft and sandy! Many happy hours were spent down there. The gym is well equipped and staff were welcoming and helpful. After speaking to other people it is clear that compared to other five start hotels in the area this one is much cheaper, and so with that in mind I would recommend it. - just don't expect genuine five star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I'd give it an A-”
Reviews.Author: BlueNinja
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a pair of friends. The hotel looks nice, the rooms are marvelous, the tub with built in jets was outstanding, and the pool with the waterfall was fun to swim in. The only complaint I have is with the internet; the wireless is difficult to connect to, incredibly slow, and will kick you off for no apparent reason.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Paradise in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: Cinders002
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Dubai today after a six night stay at this fabulous hotel. We have stayed at various 5 star resorts in Dubai, but this place is throughly Paradise in the sun! We have a one bed suite which was fabulous! It has three swimming pools, a play area for Children, a small, petite private beach and fabulous restaurants in the complex. Our stay was fantastic! The staff were lovely, very friendly, food was fabulous and the resort itself was just heavenly, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone..................5 stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “great, loved it, would go again and stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kinsred
Reviews.Content: Like most i had read the reviews on here after booking and was a little worried as all the reviews were negitive. But as always dont believe everything that you read and some of these people are over critical. (were a coupe 31 &33) Yes the room was smallish - i would say average and enough space to do what you want it for the amount of time you spend in it. The bed is king if not bigger and changed every day, you have slipper, dressing gown, smellies, towel which are changed daily. you get a dressing table, table and 2 x chairs, wardrobe. chocolates on your pillow, fruit bowl - what else could you ask for oh and bottled water every day in your room but also safe to drink the tap water. It did not have a kettle but when asked it was provided. The staff were all polite and extremely helpful, doors opened, towels put on your sun bed, if you need information they were always help. getting you a taxi etc they could not do enough for you. Hotel is very clean from the rooms to the pool area. 3 pool areas which were always pretty emty, never had a problem getting beds there was plently. The beach area is lovely too - no complaints. The hotel is in a better located then the atlantis. everything is close by. Nothing is in walking distance but the taxi are very cheap (ie £3 to the Dubai mall, £12 to Atlantis which is a 40 min drive) never tried the buses as the taxis were so cheap. There is a rep in the hotel to book excursion which we used and they were all brill and the highlight was the dessert safari. The open beach is right next to the hotel if you want to excape the hotel but we never felt the need. The drinks at the hotel were expensive, never used any of the resaurants to pass comment and there is also a night club with in the hotel but never used that either. There is a supermarked across the road and TGI Fridays and a few other shops including boots the chemist. The only down side really which no body else seems to have commented on is over the road from the hotel is the biggest mosque within dubai. It is lovely to look at but remember muslins pray 5 times a day which starts every morning at 5am and you can hear the chanting/prays at that time it used to wake us up but we also got back to sleep as it only lasts a couple of mins and by the end of the week we used to laugh about it. Also Friday is realious day and not much is open during the day but does reopen around 8pm. If on your first day you do the big bus tour it will help find your feet to where everthing is to go and visit, and it will show you a lot of sights. We also worried before going about the rules of affection etc but there is nothing to worry about there is plenty of people holding hands walking around even locas. not as strict as you think.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Laura_bristol_10
Reviews.Content: It was a good value for money hotel but the rooms are very small. The food in the two restaurant we ate in was very good quality. However, we did ordered two fruit juices when we where sat by the pool and they cost £6 each!!! The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but appealing staff and load music until 8am so could not sleep”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerIrl
Reviews.Content: Myself and the OH stayed in this hotel in Jun, 2009. I travel regularly to Dubai for work and decided to stay for an extra week and relax. We had a Duplex suite towards the back of the complex and the rooms did look really nice with an open plan layout. However we had huge problem with the Villa beside us. This is part of the complex but used at the party pad for the son of the Owner. Of the 5 night we were there we could not sleep for 3 of them because they had parties going on from 12:00 straight through to 8:00am. All night long we heard extremely loud music as well as people continuously shouting and fighting with each other right outside our bedroom window. We continuously called the reception to complain but were told that things work differently in Dubai and there is nothing they could do. Only after threatening to call the police when we heard them ordering drugs and prostitutes!!! at 2am were we told that it was being used by the owners son and it was "in our interest" not to call the police -- totally unbelievable!!! When we continued to complain and ask for another room we were told there were none available. In addition they told us that because we booked through booking.com they could do nothing in way of compensation apart from offering us a free lunch!!! What a joke and I for one will certainly make sure to discourage as many people form holidaying in Dubai as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting package - be it business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: malenykij_polgar
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort in Jumeirah with villas, having a main building for reception, gift shops, etc. Outdoor pools and an own beach will offer you all that you need. Vow. In hot months you will see yourself sitting on the golf car when you want to reach your room or the reception. There is quite a piece of nightlife on certain evenings, I guess Thursday was the most busy. The bars turn into discos and a lot of young people will enter the beach area which is actually a small bay surrounded by different style of bars and restaurants on both sides. For the rooms you will leave the reception building on the back and have a walk or a drive in the nice garden with some artificial waterfalls and fountains. Nice and clean rooms will help you rest. Great breakfast. The staff is mixed: all of them will try to help, even if not all of them will be 100% professional. All-in-all, a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boudoir”
Reviews.Author: PeachesShire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dubai Marine and Beach resort for my birthday last year and loved it. Therefore after reading the review on Time Out Dubai.com about the nightclub at the resort, Boudoir, I did not hesitate to take my friend there as we visited Dubai last weekend. I was astounded by how rude the staff were on the door. They told us it was full and when I asked if it was likely we would be able to go in if we waited until other people left, I was ignored and snubbed for another group who walked right past. It did not say on Time Out that you needed 'reservations'. Two guys also attempted to get in but were told they had to be in a 'couple'. There is absolutely no need for rudeness and snobbery. If it is reservation only then they should advertise it as this but the door staff seemed to be quite contradictory so I am not entirely sure what the 'terms of entry' were for Boudoir that evening. I would not recommend the nightclub to anyone visiting Dubai and would suggest the management either train their staff to be more polite and understand their own terms of entry, or acquire new staff. Needless to say we went to Palm Jumeriah and had a fantastic night at Sanctuary. So thanks Boudoir for introducing us to Sanctuary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: carpetking5432
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend at this hotel Great place to simply kick back and relax plenty of amenities to keep busy and good resturants that give plenty of choice though the main resturant could get a busy of a morning. Free transport into Dubai centre. Dubai is a great place to go for a long weekend but would struggle to occupy more than 5 days

Reviews.Title: “not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: maturecoupleIreland
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel .Staff were very friendly ,food was quite good .The rooms were very clean and comfortable but not five star quality .It was good value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges with no hot water”
Reviews.Author: dimitri_z
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the poor reviews. This place does not stack up to the high cost associated with staying here. The first room we were given smelled of stale smoke. They offered to refresh it. We said we need a new room so were given the worst smallest and basement room in the resort. At least it didnt smell of smoke. The shower does not have hot water. Its barely luke warm. The service at the restaurants is terrible!!! I received my drink at the end of my meal. Bread was cold and stale. mains came before the appetizers ... and it was expensive. Same at breakfast. Given knives but not forks, had to get up to get coffee. This place is not good ... certainly not for a romantic getaway. However, the rooms are clean, the bed is big and comfy, and hotel is well situated with a nice little beach.

Reviews.Title: “they will never, voluntarily, see us again . . . . ever”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFamily049
Reviews.Content: At the most this place rates between 2 to maximum, a two & a half star "resort". It looked & sounded far better than the reality of the experience. We arrived at approximately 4:30pm the afternoon. None of the staff on duty, would or could help me. I asked the bell boys at the entrance, I asked at reception, who then sent us to the concierge who then sent me back to the reception - I asked all these areas if they were expecting us & if I could please check in to then be asked what my room number is??? - it took four trips to to different areas from entering - all the while my hungry & thirsty children had nowhere in reception to sit & keep themselves busy & the Taxi driver was left in the lurch outside with all my luggage & duty free shopping while I tried to either get booked in or get moving on... The concierge kept insisting on taking my hand luggage which I never allow anyone to take. It was as if they went all out to create maximum confusion & chaos so that I was distracted continually. While I chased after my children they scanned in copies of each one of our (my children & I) passports & took their time printing the documentation while my hand luggage then disappeared to supposedly be found outside with the rest of my luggage & the taxi driver still waiting to be paid & for me to appear. The executive suite was one of the closest to the rest of the amenities according to the resort map & the main room was a nice size & the linen clean, however pull-out sleeper couch was WELL past it's life span & neither it nor the bed had mattress protectors for cleanliness. The sleeper pull-out couch was that bad that my two children could not sleep in it together it sagged that badly. Room service was poor, the food came in carried on a man's shoulder on a tray & was cold in about 3minutes flat. The fish & chips were soggy & oily. The salad insipid, pale & I'm sorry I didn't take a photo for this review. Generally the staff attitude was lethargic & disinterested. The tiles around the pool are terribly slippery & dangerous for lively youngster & though the "private beach" was just that, it was very steep & small. Added to that the lifesavers were hidden around a corner chatting at the back of the nightclub, on a wooden deck. A substantial distance from the ppols or beach & sea in the event you actually needd to "Life save" a person or heaven forbid, a child. We stumbled on them while running to catch up with our youngest heading into the sea. The internet was not easily accessible. While we checked out we asked them to order us a large taxi to take us the airport. Reputable taxi's are easily accessible in Dubai yet it took us reminding them three times & basically panicking about missing our flights & headed into us insisting that they transport us to the airport before a taxi eventually arrived. While this took place, the hotel's mini bus stood empty outside & not once did they offer it. When we insisted they transport us, they told us they would charge us Dhs120. Talk about not receiving service. The Taxi to the airport only cost us Dhs25 including a good tip. I'd like to add that in six years of extensively traveling & hiring accommodation as a family, that we've never had keys "disappear". Between unpacking the first evening & until just after breakfast tour first day including time for a bit of outside play for our children, when we returned to the room to lock up for the day, one of our sets of traveling padlock keys did "disappear". We spent three hours unpacking every single item & every single little bag (some for electronic devices, some medical aids, others toiletries, etc, etc). They were nowhere to be found. This entire experience was most unfortunately one of those "twilight" experiences, hopefully not to be repeated soon. We will be sticking to the bigger branded resorts in Dubai. We had hoped for a restful & relaxing long weekend. This was not that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive and not located where the real animation is”
Reviews.Author: alexxxandre
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 stars hotel. Rooms are tiny. Noise coming air condition even stopped. No sun light entering in the room. Fridge is tiny and doesnt work (in my case) It's not a resort, all bars and restaurants belongs to other companies and will not be able to enter with your card to clubs if you arrive too late. Be carefull with staff member trying to make you book a white private taxis, it's not 10% more but 200% more expensive. The SPA is another building. there's no sauna but a steam dirty room. The private beach is tiny, and you will have ayou have the docks not far from there... For the price you should better book to another at cheaper price than move from

Reviews.Title: “Poor communication from the staff at The Boudoir”
Reviews.Author: HKB1978
Reviews.Content: This is review for The Boudoir Nightclub and not the hotel. It was the last night of our five night stay in Dubai, and everything had been fantastic and absolutely perfect until we attempted to part the night away at The Boudoir. It was a saturday night and having phoned at 21:30 we were advised there was no cover charge. We went for drinks and food at The Buddha Bar (a must in Duba and fantastic place to chill) and then caught a taxi to The Boudoir which was at the other end of Dubai. When we arrived we were told at 01:00 we were told there was a cover charge for male and femal guests, this was incidently higher than a lot of the clubs the same night. We refused to pay and proceeded to head home, back to the other end of Dubai, this ultimately left us very disappointed especially on our last night in Dubai. We partied at several clubs in dubai, including The Sanctuary, Quantum and Zinc and had a great time but felt a little let down and very disappointed by the approach on the managemnt staff at The Boudoir.

Reviews.Title: “Rather over-rated”
Reviews.Author: opgp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location by the beach and over the road from the Jumeirah mosque. The grounds are very nice with streams and lots of trees, although the accommodation blocks are not near the pools or restaurants. We had a junior suite for one night but were a bit disappointed that it was really just like a townhouse or apartment with small windows, access through a lobby area and didn't feel at all like a resort room (we were on the ground floor). We had no complaints with the room itself which was well appointed, spacious and clean and would have been lovely in the middle of a city, but not really what we expected by the beach. Our only experience of the other facilities was breakfast, which was the worst we experienced during our whole trip - service was slow and a bit sullen, the food was limited in choice with no Arabic/ME dishes offered and what was presented was lacking in flavour. We felt the hotel was OK, mainly appealing to European groups, but expensive for what was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would come back and stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: Roshney
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TA, we were very sceptical about staying at this hotel. However once we got there, we were amazed on how clean the hotel was. We stayed in the family suite which had a luxiorious bedroom. The bed was the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in! Kiddies sofa bed was good too. The food is excellent and so was the room service. Private access to very clean beach, 3 clean swimming pools and very modern gym. Breakfast was included in our stay and was worth every penny however other food/meals were very expensive but very fresh and very tasty ! This hotel was in the best location. Staff were very friendly at all times of the day! If you compare it to the newer 5star hotels in Dubai it is a 4star but one of the best !

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad!”
Reviews.Author: Canada-Korea
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here it was due to close proximity to my business meetings. I read over some of the reviews here and really don't agree with some of them. This is not the one of the high end hotels where you pay a ton of money per night and not a 5 star. The service is not great and the restaurants borderline terrible (If you ever been to Thailand stay away from the Thai restaurant) but for a reasonable price in Dubai (I had a special) I got what I paid for. Location was good for me too, I enjoyed the recreation facilities (beach, tennis courts, gym). Warning though! When you come outside looking for a taxi the guy in the stand will try to get you take one of the white luxury cars. Do not do it, they are rip off artists. Wait for a regular cab or hail one just on the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my goodness.... I could have spent all day and night in the amazing most comfortable bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WantMoreHolidays
Reviews.Content: Our last night of our four week trip was spent at the Dubai Marine Beach Resort and Spa. With one day in Dubai our intention was to look around the city but we loved the resort so much we spent the day there! The room (and just the standard suite) was immaculate, the bed can only be described as sleeping on a cloud and the private beach and bar staff were amazing. There are plenty of restaurants and bars on site as well so you can do a lot there without even leaving the resort! Located right next to a bus stop so can easily get to Jumeirah Beach or Deira and a short distance from airport (about 50 dirhams).

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the special but”
Reviews.Author: GrahanB
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay staff were all great even though to get a cup of coffee at breakfast was an effort but otherwise good service and friendly .The hotell has 3 very nice pools and good pool and beach bars. My only gripes are the happy hour drinks are selective only beer wine and spirits no cocktails and they are not half price as happy is generally known for. Also there is no free internet access it costs approx $15 for half an hour which is to much cosidering you can go out thr front door to the mall next door and get internet access for $1.50 at the coffee shop upstairs and a nice salad and smoothy for half the price you would pay at the DMBR&S. this hotel is worth going to but only if you get a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely needs a make-over”
Reviews.Author: AutoCamel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dubai Marine Beach Club in September last year. We have stayed in many of the Dubai hotels and this place was definitely the worst. We live in Duabi now and frequent the bars and restaurants of this hotel. I am writing this review, not necessarily to rate the rooms but more so to rate the experience my friends and I have had in one of their clubs, Boudoir. We have been to this club many times. We have always liked it. Tuesday night is ladies night and the club offer free champagne to all ladies. We were at the club last night from about 10pm. It was quiet but soon filled up. In fact, over filled!! There were 6 of us in the party and were standing at the same spot at the bar for all our time in there. At about 1am, a dubai national, moved into our spot at the bar. He told me to move. I said no. He proceded to order some drinks for him and his friends. All alcoholic I might add! We were then, quite promptly, escorted out. Now, why would a club like that serve alcohol to a UAE national? Why were we asked to leave? Another issue, which disturbs me more, was the fact that my wifes drink was tampered with. This isn't the first time this has happened to someone we know. Many of our friends have had similar experiences, ie not remembering anything from the night, if even after only one drink. Chronic illness throughout the night, black outs, etc. This is not simply after having alcohol, as we have never experienced this in other bars or clubs. Only here. Yes, of course there may be other explanations for this. I understand this story may be heard the world over ffrom other bars and clubs. However, I feel that this has gone on in this club for long enough. I, or my friends, will not be going to that club again. We will recommend to our friends not to go there either. It simply not good enough to deny that drinks are being spiked. Patrons are entitled to enjoy themselves without the worry of something happening their drink and spoiling their night. This club, for the reasons above should be avoided. I do intend taking this up with hotel management. I will post their response, if any.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: JOERQ
Reviews.Content: great location-great facilities-private beach and grass areas...highly recommend executive suite booked direct with hotel 1600 AED inc breakfast...costly internet service

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe ALL you read !!”
Reviews.Author: mgw100
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I wanted to cancel this holiday,but after spending the 4days there, I can say that some people most just like to complain.The room was a good size and spotless (but make sure you insist on a balcony room and dont accept a lower ground one !) .The food was excellent especially the Tai restaurant, even the half board menu was superb. Staff was exceptional - our party was all treated like royalty. However the only dissapointment was that England did not win the Dubai rugby 7's - all said and done excellent value for money would go back their again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel for Couples...”
Reviews.Author: KateyBee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful complex with some of the nicest and most helpful staff I have ever met. The room was immaculate, cleaned everyday, fresh towels, toiletries, newspaper, fruit bowls and fresh flowers, fresh bottled water, all complementary, every day. The pools are temperature controlled and there are three: one is deep and very warm, one is large - excellent for older kids and adults alike and there is a kids pool, also excellent. All are immaculate. Free loungers and beach towels, poolside or beach, are placed for you, even down to the towels being laid out. The beach is well kept with boogie boards etc. There are several full-time lifeguards who are especially vigilant with children. If you want watersports go out from the hotel, turn right onto the public part of Jumeirah beach and you'll find them there - that beach is massive, stretching for miles. The restaurants at this hotel are not child friendly, indeed several do not permit children at all, except for at breakfast time. There is nowhere ideal to take the children in the evening on the complex either. For example, one of the bars that is next to a kid's mini playground is closed (in February anyway!). The food is expensive generally, alcohol expensive too, and not good if you have a budget! You will find many people access the hotel, especially at weekends to use the facilities and the restaurants that are not residents so it can feel that you have no exclusivity. However, whilst people can come in to the restaurants (very late as well) it should be noted that their bags are searched on entry and they have no access to the hotel rooms so you are safe. Note that parts of the complex are noisy till late. Watch out for shifty billing from the beach bar. The menu may say something is 18 dhms but you will probably get charged 38 dirhams, because you were looking at the wrong menu, even when they gave it to you! A beer was 27 dhms on the menu but billed at 35 dhms. We were charged £24 for 3 juices on our first day! The staff at the beach bar were quite ignorant about this when we complained but a quick word with the hotel manager corrected this. There are no children's menus anywhere and no children sized portions of food or drink available at all. If money is an issue for you, or if you like good value for the money you spend, go out of the hotel, turn left and eat at Japengo's. You'll get Japanese noodles, Iranian and Lebanese food - platters are awesome, pizza or pasta there so it suits everyone (despite the lack of alcohol). TAXIS: The cream coloured cabs are half the price of the white cabs. SOUKS: Take a taxi to the Gold and Spice Souks in the Bur Dubai area - if your driver looks baffled about where you want to go, ask for the Bur Dubai bus station and then ask a local where to get the Abra boats from - it's near HSBC bank if you need a landmark. You can take a boat across the manmade canal/river to the Souk - this will cost you maybe 1-2 dirhams (20-40p) and adds to the fun. When you get there, ask another local where the Gold Souk is, you probably won't ever find it otherwise....the Spice Souk is near - ask in the shops, people are almost always happy to help you. Leave enough time to take an Abra boat back over then as you disembark walk over to your left - there is an Iranian Souk there too. Don't expect to find any restaurants in these areas, although drinks are readily and very cheaply available either from drinks machines or local people with trays! Expect to pay 2 dhms (40p) for a canned juice. Go to Madinat Jumeirah (near the palm).....it's a new Arabian Souk, pricey but nice to wander. Suggest you go to Japengo's there as well as it's halve the price of the other eateries. You can take a short Abra boat tour of the "new Venice" which is quite pleasant. You're near the Jumeirah Palm in this area, short taxi ride, I would say. DESERT SAFARI. If you don't do this with Alpha Tours then when other people tell you how great it is you'll be gutted. Dune Bashing - even for young kids - is fantastic, you eat Arabic food, try traditional costume, have henna, sheesh, belly-dancing, camel riding and more. It's very good value and will suit anyone. Alcohol is available and is reasonably priced. I must say, I was surprised to see people query the rating of this 5* hotel. This is a fair rating. Can't see why anyone would say otherwise. It has all the facilities and service you would expect of a 5* hotel. Good pools, good facilities, a spa, massage area on the beach....I could go on....

Reviews.Title: “5* you're kidding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eaffy
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the luxuries and extras that come with booking a 5* hotel then Dubai marine Beach Resort should be given a wide birth. My wife and 11 year old daughter and our friends with their 2 children aged 5 and 4 were left with little choice when booking late for a Winter break but took some comfort in the fact that this hotel was rated 5* and was in Dubai, where we have previously stayed in various hotels. The Restaurants and Resort area appear to be a totally seperate enterty to the hotel and are mainly used by locals. There are numerous late night bars that don't close until 3am making certain rooms within the hotel susceptable to noise from late night music and homegoing revellers. The local Mosque is also extrememly close and would wake all but the very heaviect of sleepers at 5.30am every morning with the call for prayer. The rooms although clean, were very average despite being called "Suites" and came with none of the little extras you would expect. We were offered an upgrade to an Executive suite which we were told were slightly bigger then the Junior suites and had Balconies and Jacuzzi baths. Well, the Balconies had no view to speak of and didn't have any furniture on them, rendering them completely useless. The seperate Lounge area was used as a 2nd bedroom for the kids by means of a sofa bed which was left as a bed all week. There were no other chairs provided therefore nowhere to sit whilst getting ready to go out. The TV channels were restricted and picture quality poor. The choice and quality of food offered in the various restaurants was acceptable however, we were obliged to stay on a Half Board basis and were not advised of the arrangements on arrival. Basically you are given vouchers which can be used in 6 of the 8 restuarants (the remaining 2 are owned not owned by the Hotel). These vouchers entitled us to a choice from a set menu. However, we were made to feel like second class citizens when presenting the vouchersand were told that the children had to leave the restaurants by 9.30pm which is disgraceful for a hotel purporting to be family friendly. The pools and grounds generally are in urgent need of refurbishment and the waiter service virtualy non existent. The Tropical pool made my daughters hair and various swimming costumes turn green, which although totally unacceptable and never really explained, was compensated by the refund of our room upgrade. On checking out, our bills contained numerous spurious beverage charges which could not be accounted for and although deducted, we were not given satisfactory explanation. I cold go on, however to summarise, if you want to pay 5* prices for 3* service and accommodation then this hotel is for you. If not, stay well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but average service”
Reviews.Author: 3akwasi3
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Dubai on 20 October from Al Ain. We had great expectations of this hotel. The setting is undeniably fine and very well placed to tour the city. However, the check-in staff seemed more keen to get you to upgrade your room than anything else. Room was not bad at all despite refusing upgrades. Delightful garden setting made the place. Beach bar very slow and the food was left sitting on the counter for sometime before the waiter decided to bring it to us. We were not impressed by the food from the two resturaunts we tried in the evening which did seem a bit expensive for what they offered. Excessive air conditioning seemed the norm here - to the point of being quite uncomfortable to us who were acclimatised to the heat of the Emerates. After seeing other places in Dubai, I would not return

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of note in any world-wide selection”
Reviews.Author: Mournes
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 nights from 8/10/08. We had read some adverse comments but found them to be without foundation. It is an excellent hotel, an oasis of comparitive peace fairly near the city centre but with noteworthy restaurants, beach, pools, water features and a very friendly staff - all at a reasonable price for Dubai. We stayed in standard rooms (one in each) in Villa 35. Up - graded rooms are probably better but the standard room is certainly adequate for1/2 people.Any criticisms are very minor eg. no tea or coffee making facilities available in bedrooms. Buggies can be called to take one to a restaurant in the evening and home again. There is an influx of young people in evenings to party and enjoy themselves. And why not? They have a good time and do not interfere with the (mostly older) hotel residents. It is a 2 storey level hotel and lifts are not needed. We never used one.Taxis are cheap and on instant call - but get one with a meter! The hotel is a welcome contrast to some of the oddly shaped, high rise buildings in glass anr concrete. Mind you some of the concrete is nicely coloured! Whatever problems Dubai may have in the shape of heat, traffic and lack of notable scenery this hotel remains a perfect oasis. We would recommend it to all normal people!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: TheHeathies
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay and we had a great time, never been to Dubai before but were given the opportunity to upgrade to a junior suite for an additional £30 which was well worth it, separate area to chill, read etc a bigger bathroom and a walk in wardrobe. Staff were all very attentive and couldn't do enough for you, tipping wasn't expected but is appreciated if you are that way inclined. Beach wasn't to crowded and the sea was the nicest that I have every experienced, warm and clear, sunloungers were really comfortable. The only down side of the whole holiday was that our first morning conflicted with the last day of Rammadam and the noise from the temple began very early and went on for several hours and we did feel that we should have been advised that this would happen. We ate at the Thai, Lebbanese and Mexican restaurants and the food was excellent. The Lebbanese restaurant lives up to it reputation for the amount of food by the way, we have very healthy appetites but there was way to much for 2 people. I would certainly consider going back to this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 star heaven”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool196
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a three bedroom suite having paid for a two bedroom suite. There is a lot of building work going on in the area but once you get through the front doors it is five star luxury all the way. Fabulous building, friendly and efficient staff. Only downside was the lifts take ages and staying on the 42nd floor meant we often had to wait. Fabulous hotel which I would recommend to anyone. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse”
Reviews.Author: antares_200
Reviews.Content: Be careful with the people who works in the hotel, this is the first time I go to a resort in Dubai and I have problem, maybe It is near to the beach but this is the worse one, in dubai all the resorts are incredible except this one. If you have another chance go to another, with better services.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dubai Marine”
Reviews.Author: Bailey69
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its more central location between the city and beach, as we wanted a beach resort but didn’t fancy being so far away from the attractions of the city as some of the Jumeirah beach hotels were. Our standard room was not really a 5 star room and could do with being updated but nevertheless was very comfortable and clean. The bed was very large and comfy, the sheets were changed every day, as were the towels. There was a TV, dressing table and chairs, a wardrobe with dressing robes and slippers. The room had an electronic safe, fridge and mini bar. The bathroom had a reasonable shower over a bath, toilet and bidet and a small selection of free toiletries. You didn't need to take your own beach towels as you're given a towel card each and were allowed to take up to 2 towels at any given time. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and dined each morning in the Taverna restaurant, including our first morning while we waited for our room to be ready. Service was prompt and we only had to wait an hour for our room, even though it was only 8am. There was ample choice of cereals, fruit juices, fresh fruit, cooked breakfast, continental breakfast and omelettes/waffles/pancakes made freshly infront of you of your own choice with tea or coffee. The resort itself is all on one level and has a lovely relaxed, informal feel. The staff were always very friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough to please. My daughter and myself really enjoyed our stay. There were plenty of sunloungers and any staff member would move them to where you wanted them and would bring you a parasol and a table if you wished. There were lifeguards on duty at each of the pools. There was some evidence of building work within the hotel grounds. They were laying a new wooden patio area near one of the pools but this hardly distracted guests from their holiday enjoyment. The hotel grounds are very beautiful and quiet and lead down to the small individual beach cove. Posh and stylish it is not, but the Dubai Marine is the place to relax and enjoy the sun in friendly, comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Just trying to book was a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Abroad25
Reviews.Content: After looking at working in South Africa for a few months I decided to detour Dubai on the way back to England. I found this hotel and thought it looked nice. After reading the reviews on here I was rather dubious but thought I'd give it a go. I contacted the hotel direct and was quoted a great half board rate. In fact it was so great I double checked it with them twice - each time they confirmed it was correct. After 3 days of correspondence checking all was in order I went to book my flights and the hotel. When I came to book the hotel however they had added on an additional dhs 1080 per person per night - a large additional charge. When I queried this with them, I was informed that the half board rate they quoted did not include accomodation!! I could not believe they classed half board as meals only. They said I should have known accomodation was extra. As far as I was concerned half board is your board and your meals. Obviously not at this hotel. Needless to say if they can't even get this bit right, I am not spending my money to stay here - imagine what else would be wrong!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: joanmac
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews of this resort, I was slightly apprehensive, despite the fact that my sister (who is based in Saudi) had stayed there on several occasions, and was happy to recommend it. We chose this hotel partly for its central location between the city and beach, and were perfectly happy with it as an easy point from which to explore Dubai, especially as we wanted a beach resort but didn’t fancy being so far away from the attractions of the city as some of the Jumeirah beach hotels turned out to be. While I have to agree that the rooms are a bit basic, and the décor is a bit dull and not as stylish as one might find in other 5 star hotels, they were very comfortable and clean – our balcony room (one step up from a standard room) was a good size, with all the facilities you would expect, and a lovely big comfy bed! The on-site facilities are excellent, and the food in all the restaurants we tried for evening meals was very good, although there were a couple of negative aspects regarding breakfast and lunch. 1. We stayed on a room only basis and paid for a buffet breakfast in the Taverna restaurant on our first morning, but although there was a good range of food we felt a bit aggrieved at being charged around £20 for 2 breakfasts although my husband only had 2 very disappointing cups of instant coffee. For the rest of the week I ordered room service while my husband went to Starbucks round the corner so we were happy! 2. On days when we stayed at the beach we ate at the beach bar, and while the food itself was excellent and plentiful, there were only around 6 tables, which sometimes meant quite a wait to get seated, and despite the small number of tables, the food service was very slow. Those points aside, the resort itself has a lovely relaxed, informal feel, and contrary to what other reviewers have said, the staff are very friendly and helpful, and we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay here. The low rise villa accommodation set among beautiful gardens provided a lovely environment, which was very peaceful and tranquil (occasionally punctuated by the calls to prayer from the Mosque nearby, but that is part of the culture of the place). There was no evidence of building work within the hotel grounds, although I understand that the place has changed a bit over the years, so previous guests may have been a bit unlucky in this respect. Nor were we aware of any building or road works close to the hotel, although we did see quite a bit of this throughout the city – but it did not impact on our stay at all. In all, I would say to prospective travellers – think about what it is you want from a hotel. If you want somewhere posh, stylish and formal, then perhaps this is not the place for you. But if you want a relaxed holiday in lovely surroundings with an excellent range of facilities and friendly, efficient and helpful staff, then give this a go – we will certainly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Winegum
Reviews.Content: Really not 5 stars. 3 at best. The reception staff was unfriendly and incompetent. The rooms were small and old. The beds were uncomfortable. They have about 4 restaurants. Only the buffet type is open during the day. For a lousy buffet they charge $100. They beach could be ok if it weren't for the oil tankers and the harbor 500m down the road. There are so many nice hotels in Dubai. Don't waste your time and money in this one.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right place for a quiet break!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: titchLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday at the very last minute (booked on 8th August and flew out on 14th August). We only went out for 5 days. Due to this we didn't have much choice in hotels to stay at. My sister had been to Dubai in May this year and twice last year, she actually recommened the Habtoor Grand and the Oasis (very good by the way). These were fully booked and we were only left with Dubai Marine Resort and Spa. My husband and I thought we'd risk it for a biscuit even though the last few reviews of the hotel had been quite bad (too be honest I don't know what planet these people lived on but their reviews of this hotel were unjust!!!!) Ok from the start of the holiday we flew with Emirates (economy class). Compared to British Airways they were fantastic. We had great seats and food was fine. You have your own TV screen and hundreds of films to choose from. One more tip join Emirates Skywards loyalty scheme and make sure you opt for meet and greet service as you get through passport control with a click of a finger. We wished we had done this as we waited ages to get through, almost an hour (not something you want to do after travelling for 7hours). We arrived in Dubai in the early hours of (15th August) Wednesday morning. (The Dubai airport duty free is great). A good tip buy some alcohol at the airport as Dubai is an alcohol free country, therefore it is very expensive to buy in any hotel or bar. The heat in August is unbelieveable (44oc upwards in the day and 35oc at night), it hit us like a slap in the face as soon as we stepped off the plane. We had no problems getting to hotel as we had arranged transfers, very advisable if you don't want to go looking for a taxi in the middle of the night. The hotel is on Jumeriah road and on the city end of Jumeriah beach about 20mins taxi ride from the main hotels on Jumeriah beach. Don't let that put you off as it a goods place to be for the shopping and sand safari. On arrival at hotel, we checked in and the receptionist offered to upgrade us to one of their junior suites for about £28 extra per night. We actually said yes!! (Yes I know, we shouldn't have agreed without looking at the new room). Anyway we booked in without any problems and were driven to our room in a golf buggy. Good idea as we were shattered by then. Yes there is building works going on but only in the day when most guests are away from their rooms. In all honesty it is the same anywhere you stay in Dubai as we had made a few friends in differents hotels from the trips we had done and they thought the same. The junior suite was big, new and very clean. The free toilettries were all Molton Brown (great for me as that's what I use). We were also left with 2 bottles of mineral water a basket of fruit and some other things. The bed in the suite was queen size. The bathroom had a jacuzzi and very powerful shower. The next day we felt a bit silly upgrading as we didn't feel the suite was worth the extra money. We down graded back to a standard room (no problems with the hotel for the change) , which to be honest was just fine as we hardly spent anytime in it. The differences between the rooms are no jacuzzi in the standard bathroom but same shower, just normal toilettries, king size bed instead of queen, no dining table and chairs in standard room, no free fruit or water (but that's for the first night only), both rooms have an electronic safe. Otherwise everything else is the same including fridge and mini bar but cheaper with the standard room. You don't need to take your own beach towels as you're given a towel card each and are allowed to take upto 2 towels each at any given time. We had a good first nights rest, even though the hotel is near a mosque (which is pretty common where ever you stay in Dubai, bear in mind that you are visiting a muslim country). We missed the buffet breakfast on the first day, so had lunch instead (The breakfasts and lunches are served in the Taverna). I wasn't sure at first about the food as it look a bit yuckky, (I'm indian by the way and am very used to eating curries and odd foods.) My reservations about the food and restaurant was all wrong because of the previous bad reviews. The food was fine and caters for all. Lots of fruits and salad available as it's too hot to eat heavy meals in the day (however big meals are there if you want). Some foods are carried over to the next meal but to be honest that's expected in any hotel you stay in Dubai even the really expensive ones. Do not attempt to take any fruit or food outside the restaurant as you are not allowed. We saw some Russian bloke feel very stupid when the restaurant manager confiscated his full carrier bag, that he had been slyly filling throughout breakfast so unless you want to look an idiot in front of everyone don't do it as they class it as stealing!!!!! The beach has nearly white sand and very clear warm water, it is small, pretty and private from locals and other hotels. I thought the beach was very clean and there are more than enough beds & umbrellas to go round. There is none of this business of germans and towels at dawn, whatever time of day we went onto the beach we found a good spot. There is a guy who will come round and put up an umbrella and bed where ever you want to park your butt. A bit of warning the sand gets very hot and you will need fip flops that won't melt in the sun to get from the beach to the sea (only a few steps but enough to burn your feet). There are also a couple of security guards patroling the beach, so you don't really need to worry about your valuables whilst you're in the water or away from your bed. There are 3 swimming pools and the sea, which all have fully qualified lifeguards at all times. At lunch times we either ate at the beach bar or at our sun beds. The food is fresh and plentiful. The mocktails (cocktails without alcohol are fab). We ate out in Meena Bazaar most nights as it's cheap and lots to choose from (about 20mins taxi ride). Try everything, you only live once!!! We loved the Lebanise food. Wherever you go in Dubai it's too hot to walk and you will need a car or taxi which are very cheap. For the women take a thin shawl or a cardigan as the temperature from the outside to the inside of any shop can vary up to 20oc, (it's like have hot & cold flushes). There is virtually no crime in Dubai because if anyone commits a crime they are kicked out of the country instantly and will never be allowed back in. Good idea I think!!! We only had one evening meal in the hotel and that was at the Italian on our last night. To be honest we thought it was over priced, especially the wine but we didn't mind as we had saved so much money the other nights eating at local places. The food was ok considering we weren't in Italy. (For all the men make sure you take some closed toe shoes for the evenings as all hotels, clubs and restaurants will refuse entry to open toed shoes. Smart trainers are acceptable). My only gripe with the hotel was that they lost my favourite dress which I had sent to be pressed on for our last evening. I actually lost the plot with the house keeping manager as this was unacceptable to me. My husband sorted it out for me and I did get my dress back, although I found out that the same thing had happened to another guest on the same day. I know it wasn't the hotel's fault as the dry cleaning was contracted out to a local firm and it was out of their hands. The hotel couldn't apologise enough and as compensation they didn't charge us for any of the other stuff we had cleaned as well, which I though was fair enough.
