In whole we thought Dubai Marine Resort and Spa is a nice simple hotel and ideal for couples, friends and families to stay at. It shouldn't be classed a 5 star, more a high 3 or a low 4. The staff are very friendly and always keen to help. I have already recommened it to some friends who are going there in a couple of weeks. In your room you will find a Timeout magazine for Dubai, make sure you read it as it has good tips and recommendations on where to go for food, music and shopping and it always upto date. Make sure you put aside a day for the Wild Wadi water park as it is just amazing. We have never had so much fun, we went in at 11:30am and didn't leave until 6pm. People were still coming in as we were leaving. Do try and do the Sand Safari as it's a once in a lifetime experience. It's definately not for the faint hearted. I get car sick quite quickly and was ill right on que through the trip but it was well worth it. I would do it again in a heart beat. We booked both of these trips with a company called Amazon Travel in Meena Bazaar (speak to a guy called Kishan Pattani). They are a honest company and cheaper than most. You will be able to que jump at Wild Wadi with tickets bought from them. I hope that all that I have written will help you enjoy your trip to Dubai, whether you're just going for sun, sea and sand, shopping or adventure. We would go back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hanz_Bahrain
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many five-star hotels in Dubai and I have to say this is the worst. There is no way this hotel deserves the five star rating. For the price of a room here, you can stay in other hotels on Jumeirah beach that are much better quality. I reserved a standard room for my girlfriend and I and when I got there I was shocked to see how small the room was. It was more like a motel room. I booked a King-size bed but the bed was smaller than a queen. It would have been so uncomfortable fitting two people on that bed. I complained to the front desk and they told me that standard rooms either had a queen bed (theres no way that bed was even queen-size) or two joinable beds (?) but the suites had a King-bed. I decided to upgrade to a Junior suite which was better but still not five-star quality that one would expect for the price. The carpet in the living room was dirty and full of cigarette burns. The couches looked old and even the towels in the bathroom didnt smell fresh. Even worse, when I got into bed I felt itchy all over. I thought I was being paranoid but my girlfriend felt the same thing. I dont even wanna think about what it was. I booked for 9 nights at this hotel but after two hours, I decided I had to check out as soon as possible. Unfortunately, the front desk wouldnt let me check out without paying a penalty and they told me to contact the travel agent I booked through (even though the travel agent had informed me beforehand that all cancellations were to be made with the hotel directly). Anyway, the travel agent contacted the hotel and they finally allowed me to check-out without a penalty, but unfortunately I had to waste two nights there. The only thing good I can say about this hotel is that they have pretty good restaurants and nightclubs which are very popular. El Paso has got good food and Sho Cho and Boudoir are very happening. But you dont need to stay in the hotel to visit these establishments. To sum it up: dont stay here if you want a five-star experience. Check out Grosvenor House, Royal Meridien, Hilton Jumeirah. They are all around the same price and much better than this badly managed, sorry excuse for a five-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Tripmonster
Reviews.Content: Hotel chosen because of proximity to work related meetings for my partner as this was the reason for the trip. Disappointing 1st impression as arrived to a room with the wrong bed configuration and broken air conditioning. Partner had a meeting 1st thing so this was very inconvenient and wasted lots of time before we were moved to a better room which made him late for his 1st appt, we were also extremely tired after gruelling overnight cramped flights. Partner had made several phone calls and emails prior to our arrival to ensure that room was as requested so we were very angry that they still managed to get it wrong. Rooms etc are dated but spacious and comfortable with good Molton Brown toiletries. We had a suite with a bedroom, lounge area and huge bathroom. No key given for the mini bar so had to request one! TV in bedroom and lounge. All rooms/suites are set in blocks between meandering paths and lush planting. I am a very light sleeper but didn't hear the call to prayer once so must depend on where you are situated. There is a very small private beach but had huge jellyfish in sea so we didn't use it. Pools are lovely, one seemed to be shallower and perfect for kids with a shaded play area with play equipment for them. One was as warm as a bath and another with a waterfall was more shaded so good to cool down in. Life guards are on duty at all pools. There were plenty of sunbeds and parasols which, once you had found / got the attention of one of the staff, were moved and set up for your convenience. The food at the beach bar was very hit or miss and it took forever to get any of the staff to understand you, not many had a good grasp of English. Also they were very slow at everything but I guess that was because of the heat! Ate at two of the restaurants on site which were good and frequented by non residents mainly, in fact whole hotel becomes a hot spot for non residents at night. We passed Chris Eubank just entering 'Restaurant Boudoir' as we left! On the whole we found the staff to be difficult to communicate with and not very forthcoming. Hotel is quite a drive from the main 'Jumeirah strip' hotels and attractions, with the usual crazy traffic. Hotel wanted a whole nights rate to keep the room until our late departure which seemed very unreasonable especially with the cock-up they made on our arrival. If going on holiday to Dubai we would not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pepsi_enya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in June/July 05 & it was amazing!! The weather was great, which is always a great start to any holiday! On Arrival check in couldn't have been more helpful & we were quickly taken off to our room in a "Golf Cart" The rooms were spacious clean and tidy & the Air Con was a must with the heat. The beach was amazing, I am usually not a beach person, but I think I went into the pool once! I will warn you though, as my partner found out probably not best to sun bath for 6 hours straight in this heat, she actually passed out one day, but the staff were again amazing & helped me get her back to the well air conditioned room. Unfortunately for her the staff remembered her for the rest of our stay. There are a number of lovely restaurants on site, we tried the Italian & Thai, which were great, but there were so many more to choose from. We were able to book day trips out from our hotel, which was handy & also at reasonable prices. The Desert Trip is a must!! All in all we loved Dubai and this hotel and would definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb villa style hotel”
Reviews.Author: thinbags
Reviews.Content: 5 Star luxury. Villa style hotel. One bedroomed villa has huge luxury bathroom with jet spa bath, large lounge with sofas and dining table. TV in lounge and bedroom. King size bed. 3 swimming pools and 5 restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but def not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: 100shy
Reviews.Content: We moved from the Hilton Creek to be on the beach and whilst the facility is not bad, I found the hotel dated and not in the usual upmarket spirit of Dubai. The rooms were clean and comfortable and most of the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was terrible. It felt like a Russian Republic sitting on the Beach, I never heard anyone speaking English. The one good thing is that if you are up for a party, attached to the hotel are very popular bars where all the hitters go to unwind late in the evening. It doesnt affect the hotel or guests and there is no noise. Its worthwhile just standing outside watching the Ferrari's and Lambo's pulling in.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: jes59
Reviews.Content: We dreaded the thought of staying in a large hotel in the mass of developments going on in Jumeriah Beach. So we chose a location closer to the city and were exceedingly pleased with the hotel we chose. The suites were very spacious, though one had a superior layout and much more natural light. The beach was perfect and ther ewas a wonderful selection of restaurants within the hotel. The location is fantastic, Spinneys is 2 mins walk away to get supplies of water and nibbles. There is plenty space in the room mini bar for bottles of wine etc. We would definitely go back to this hotel as it has a lovely atmosphere and beautiful landscaped gardens and streams with low rise buildings, quite are rarity in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: congus1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel with my girlfriend. We both found it to be absoloutley fantastic! After reading some of the reviews listed below i did start to have second thoughts, but after great flights with Virgin Atlantic we both arrived at the hotel fresh as can be at 7.30am. We went straight to reception where we checked in and were told that the room would be ready by 9.00am, and sure enough at 8.45am we were given the keys. WOW! thats all we could say as we walked to our villa, the grounds are just superb, with little streams running through to split up the properties. The room was quite large and had been prepared to a high standard, with fruit and chocolates on the table which were replenished everyday. We both found all the facilities at the hotel top class, and the private beach is just fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Dubai as there is no building work nearby and the location makes it easy to visit the city centre or venture down jumeriah beach road. If your looking for a place to stay look no more and just book!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dubai Marine in September 2006 as part of a holiday package 2 stop deal so we found it to be excellent value. The rooms were very good, clean, modern and located in fantastic gardens with waterfalls and streams. The restaurants and bars in the hotel are excellent. Similar to a previous reviewer, the staff at reception let the hotel down badly! We arrived very early about 7am after a 9 hour trip from Mauritius. We expected an early check as we were told this was the norm in Dubai. However, the girl at reception, Alex, was incredibly unfriendly and unhelpful. We were told there were no rooms available before 10.30. This was despite the fact that we saw people checking out. Also, the restaurant for breakfast was effectively empty as we spent an hour in there. Her attitude and demenour really let the hotel down. Other than this, I have only positive things to say about the hotel. It is quite a distance from the Burj, water parks, about 20minutes in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star treatment”
Reviews.Author: HighflyerAC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 7th Sept to 13th Sept 2006. We had problems the moment we arrived. Since our flight landed at 7am we arrived at the hotel by 8am. This being our 5th visit to Dubai never had any problems with early checkins at any other hotel. However, upon trying to checkin we were told we would have to wait until around 2pm-3pm before a room was available. Reason being was that the hotel was full. When I offered to pay "half day rate" the lady at the counter (who was very rude) told me she would have a room available with in 1 hour. So obviously they did have rooms available but were not prepared to let us checkin early for free. By time they had a room ready it was 11am, and i was not prepared to pay £70 for a 3 hour early checkin! At this point i spoke to a manager (who only became available at 11am) who apologised and let my wife and I check in. Having thought this was the only problem we would have, when we saw our "junior suite" I was not happy, it was on the ground floor, very dark because no light was allowed in through the hedge as our view. At this point we headed to the pool area, the pool itself and the area around it was nice, but again the service let the hotel down. It took 35mins for me to get a coke that I ordered, not dubai standards. I could go on and let you know about further lack of service at this hotel but it would take me too long to write it down. To sum up, pay the extra and stay somewhere else. PS. The beach was very small and not to the standards of other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Malisa
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff in the morning are curtious. However, the hotel staff in the evening is completely the opposite. It's like a curse comes on this hotel at the evening time. It's actually a nightmare to try getting into the hotel every night. Reason being is that there is only one access to the hotel without an exit. You might be surprised but YES this is the fact. The only exit out of this *what they call 5 stars* hotel is only through Jumaira beach stree. There are 6 restaurants and 2 different clubs on the hotel premises which makes accessibility to the hotel everynight like hell. If you go to the hotel to visit any of the restaurants or clubs you might enjoy it, but if you choose to live there, I believe it might be a big mistake. The second evening of my arrival, I went out and then got back to pick up something from the hotel and then come back to catch a movie. Guess what, it took us more than an hour to drive in and out of the hotel that night (which was a regular week-night!!!!). Two movies have passed by the time I got out of the beach strip (which was the only way out). One other major problem in this hotel is if you would want to use the internet, they charge 1 derham per minute for the DSL connection which is really crazy compared to other 5 stars hotels in Dubai that offer it sometimes for free! The other major problem about the hotel is its rooms which they call villas. They are actually very small in size compared to other suites in other 5 stars hotels. The main room in each villa is relatively small compared to other 5 stars hotels that we stayed in previously. In addition, the rooms seem to be a little old and humid inside, TV remote didn't work! One good thing about the bathrooms that there is a built-in engine for making bubbles in the bath but who needs that when there are many other problems the hotel is facing. I met two managers at the hotel and provided some feedback, both seemed to be very calm and negative at the same time. All management staff in this hotel seem to be clearly a cheap labor and not a 5-stars professional management staff. To sum up, this hotel is not worth the money. You would be way better off investing your money in any of the other major 5 stars hotels in Dubai area so you can enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great great great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: rackiec
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day stopover on the way home to Europe and stayed here. This hotel is great. The rooms are nice - we had a junior suite and had the kids on the pullout sofa, although we could have done with an extra toilet! The service was fantastic. There are 3 pools and lots of pool recliner thingos and staff on hand. Can I suggest that the hotel put a cover over the kids pool. The restaurants were good except for the arabian one that tried to give us meze at enormous cost and then started bargaining with us when we left - it was a set meal which they didn't tell us about! It has the best nightclub in dubai too! A final word of praise for the spa - I highly recommend Vicky for nails and toes and the lovely Indian lady from Bangalore for the best eyebrows I have ever had;

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Profshopper
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stay stayed at the Dubai Marine Resort & Spa from 5th Aug-9th Aug 06. We had a FANTASTIC time & will certainly be going back. I managed to booked a Junior suite on a ukhoteldiscount website for "corporate rates", & it worked out very reasonable (approx £50pp pn inc full buffet breakfast) The suite was HUGE, with a separate living [large TV with good variety of satellite channels], dinning area, massive King size bed in the bedroom [+another large TV] , walk in wardrobe & marble bathroom with 2 sinks, big wall-wall mirror & a great power shower above the jaccuzi bath. Our room was cleaned twice a day. The resort itself is large & a complimentary buggy service operates to for those who do not wish to walk the short distance to their rooms. With 9 top quality restaurants & 3 or 4 bars, there is something to suit everyone's tastes. We sampled the Thai, Lebanese, Mexican & Japanese- all serving very generous portion sizes of YUMMY food. Liver entertainment was also provided most nights (I believe my husband's favourite was the tall, blonde Belly Dancer!) The location on Jumeria beach but on the outskirts of Deira city is also ideal. Local taxi's are cheap, air-conditioned & in frequent supply ( cost us approx £4 to the go to the Mall of the Emirates). However the taxi's which the porter hailed which are always waiting outside the hotel, offers a nice luxurious alternative for around 15-20% more, you can be driven in a leather interior white Lexis! If I had to fault the resort, it would be that we were not made aware on their website that there would be building works carried out on either side of the small private beach. However, work usually stopped by 10/11am, so noise pollution did not spoil our enjoyment of the crystal clear warm water of the Arabian Sea. Also, the resort forgot to provide complimentary anniversary gift on the correct date ( but more than made up for it with a delightful home made strawberry sponge cream cake & a bottle of wine 2 days later!! :-) All in all, a VERY enjoyable experience. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “fanf**-in tastic”
Reviews.Author: mit73
Reviews.Content: I have only just realised that you can leave reviews hence the late entry on this hotel. We travelled to the UAE like planes trains and automobiles as missed first flight....however on getting to Dubai we first booked to stay at the Radison in Sharjah as the travel agent assured me (via phone) that it was excellent (wrong) as there is no alcohol at this hotel anywhere in Sharjah...the hotel was good in letting us pay for one night saying we would prefer Dubai beach resorts for more lively things to do.. We booked into the Dubai Marine Resort and found the standard and service to be absolutly fantastic. The staff and all the people of Dubai were very very nice. We had rented a car so were able to visit the surroundings but as I enjoyed the hotel so much I left most of this for my husband... the beach is great as it is clear and not crammed out and I found that the fact that it is small was fantastic as I could see my partner if he was in the sea and it just seemed so much more private than anything I have ever experienced ( would def. take kids as you can see all over beach) There are more than enough restaurants and bars just on this complex that you dont need to venture out for this... we tried most of the restaurant and the bars which we on till early hours in the morning with big cues but as you stay at this hotel you are allowed in first. Also please try the Gold Souk I go a PLATINUM DIAMOND RING WHICH THEY SAID WAS 2 CARROTS AND WHEN GOT VALUED HERE IT WAS 4AND A HALF CARROTS. FANTASTIC ALL THE WAY AND WILL BE BACK VERY SOON

Reviews.Title: “Just book it!!”
Reviews.Author: Rashid187
Reviews.Content: stayed in dubai marine in july 05 when the weather was approx 40degrees, i found the hotel very comfortable and spacious with plenty of facilities. the staff were brilliant very helpful from reception right down to car park attendants. i had no problems at all everything was easily accessible and they even surprised me with a complimentary bday cake which tasted great. the food from the restaurants are very tasty but my favourite was the breakfast buffet so many varieties all freshly prepared fruits, juices, bakery, full english, continental every breakfast item you could ever think of and if you cant decide just ask the chef to prepare you something. smashing! ...the hotel is practically equedistant from most tours or shoping centres. enjoyable and relaxing with great views definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Dubai !”
Reviews.Author: Gloucestergirl
Reviews.Content: Dubai Marine Beach Resort and Spa. This hotel is situated at the very end of the Jumeriah Beach, sandwiched between the Dry Docks with its towering cranes and building works on the beach. The entire length of the Jumeriah Road has been taken up and is being relaid, widened I guess, although its hard to tell with all the jumble of things happening there. The consequence is that you do have noise on a 24/7 basis, although you cannot hear it in the grounds of the hotel, mainly because of its own construction noises either side. The Dubai Marine Resort and Beach is a little dated in the outer buildings, but nicely laid out grounds surrounding the apartments, which they refer to as villas. The Jumeriah Beach Hotel, some 6 miles along the beach is the ultimate in modern hotels, and worth a visit to the outside lift there as you get wonderful views for miles and miles. Dubai is a nightmare for traffic and jams, forget anything you get into back home, its 24/7 hell on earth if you hire a car. Avoid Avis in the hotel, seek out a much cheaper one in the yellow pages, or so we were told by the Avis rep, too honest for his own good. The shopping is not as good as we are led to believe. The shops around the hotel are some of the best quality, with the rest of the clothes not being to the taste of the english. Restaurants in Dubai offer excellent value food, often bringing two and three extra courses at no cost. If you go to the Oman, dont forget your visa and be patient, getting into the Oman is reasonably easy, getting out is harder, and takes a lot of time so you need patience and a high respect for the border controllers. Muscat is great, especially the Crowne Plaza, and that side of the land mass is warmer, the sea definitely warmer and very much cheaper. If you are going for three days to Dubai thats fine, but any longer you will be bored, after the gold souk and the dwindling spice souk, and trip up the Creek has lost its lustre. The jabal mountains are spectaculuar and dont miss Nizwar betwixt Muscat and Dubai, the delightful hill top village, with very cheap accommodation, on the way into town on the left, at £28 a night for the two of you. A tank of petrol £6. cant be bad can it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: BigAnthony
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel to stay if you are on vacation, it has very nice rooms in seprate buildings and very good restaurants The only problem is that the service tends to be slow and at 50 degrees it is a little bad unconvenient to move between the rooms and the reception area knowing that you will have to pass by a graden to get between them
